original: Ljungberg, Sven Johan Fritiof, andre stadsläk., Norrköping, f. 11/11/07 i Norrköp. av överlär. Anders L. o. Elin Andersson. G. 37 m. Karin Kihl-berg. Barn: Björn f. 38, Krister 42. — Studrex. i Norrköp. 26, med. kand. v. Karol. inst. 29 o. med. lic. där 35. E. o. aman. v. Karol. inst. anat. inst. 29, tf. und:läk. v. Vadstena las. fyra mån. 36-37, v. Ljungby las. tre mån., andre und :’läk. v. Kronpr. Victorias kustsanat. 37, förste dito 38-39, förste und:läk. v. Flens las. 39-42, andre und:läk. v. Södertälje las. kir. avd. 42, förste dito 43-45, prakt. läk. i Norrköp. sed. 45, inneh. förordn. som andre stadsläk. i Norrköp. 45 o. 46, andre stadsläk. där sed. 47. Marinläk:-stip. över stat 32, tjg. som fartygs-läk. samt som e. läk. v. kustart. i Vaxholm o. Karlskrona, marinläk :stip. i res. 34, marinläk. av 2. gr. i res. 38, av 1. gr. 42. Skr.: upps. o. skr., spec. i oilycksfallsfrågor.
translated: Ljungberg, Sven Johan Fritiof, second city physician, Norrköping, born on November 11, 1907 in Norrköping, son of headmaster Anders L. and Elin Andersson. Married in 1937 to Karin Kihlberg. Children: Björn, born in 1938, Krister, born in 1942. Studied in Norrköping until 1926, medical candidate at Karolinska Institute in 1929 and medical license obtained in 1935. Employed as assistant and trainee at Karolinska Institute and Anatomy Institute from 1929. Temporary deputy physician at Vadstena hospital for four months in 1936-1937, three months at Ljungby hospital, and second deputy physician at Crown Princess Victoria's Coastal Sanatorium in 1937. Became first deputy physician from 1938-1939 at Flens hospital, and from 1939-1942, second deputy physician at Södertälje hospital surgical department. Became first deputy physician from 1943-1945 at Södertälje hospital surgical department. Established a private practice in Norrköping from 1945 and appointed as second city physician in Norrköping in 1945-1946, and has been serving as city physician since 1947. Awarded a stipend as a naval physician in 1932, served as a ship's physician and as a naval physician in Vaxholm and Karlskrona. Received a naval physician stipend in 1934 and was promoted to the rank of second-grade naval physician in 1938, and first-grade in 1942. Written publications and papers, specializing in accident-related matters.
